text: Good morning.  I'm just getting started with HubSpot.  How can I do a test import of data that doesn't affect my actual account?

You can set up a test account, under your developer account, which is free.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/how-do-i-create-a-test-account>

Hi everyone :slightly_smiling_face:
Is there a way use API in the way to implement <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/get-started-with-smart-content|"smart content"> alike feature on own CMS like Drupal, Wordpress,..
So for example that landing page on Drupal CMS is different based on persona (saved in HubSpot) and its cookie data that reveals the user/persona on website. I am just asking if HubSpot API allows that and what kind of request is needed. Thank you.

Hi everyone, I am not a dev or tech guy at all, so I had a prospect ask me if he uses the *transactional email api* he could check on metrics, deliverability, opens and clicks through the api instead of directly on HubSpot email.

Does anyone know if that's possible?
*Feature request*: Please make it possible to link to a specific endpoint in the new V3 docs.

Hey Zan, while it’s technically possible, it’s definitely not the easiest things. With rate limits, you’d need to essentially recreate your entire contacts Database in Drupal and set up all your rules there. Happy to go into more detail if you are interested in giving it a go

It’s possible, but you don’t need the transactional API to do it. You can get them aggregated through the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/lists/marketing-email-overview|Marketing Email API> or you can get each individual open/click/delivery/send event through the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/email/email_events_overview|Email Events API>

Hey <@U012LKRF0RJ> this is definitely on our roadmap. Right now we are iframing in a react app into the documentation pages which makes that kind of linkign very difficult. We’re working on getting that app running directly in the CMS which would allow you to get a link directly to a specific Endpoint
